website_summaries.verdict: Versatility is an important consideration when it comes to bench vises, and the Yost 865-D2 is definitely versatile. Reversible jaws and a lockable swivel base should provide enough flexibility for most clamping needs. Great all-around vise.
pros: Original 7-inch jaw width can easily expand to 11 inches for larger jobs
360-degree swivel base locks down for precise angles
Reversible jaws for heavy-duty and delicate clamping
cons: Some quality-control issues with steel casting and painting

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I added a pic with a level held in the vise so you can see how close to the edge I mounted the vise and how much gap there is between the workbench and the level. The operation is nice and smooth. It feels really solid, but I've only done a few light jobs with it so I can't comment on durability.
customer_reviews.author: KillBill

customer_reviews.title: Amazing vise
customer_reviews.text: This is a big vise with big features. The base is robust and the locks are positive and hold the vise very well. The big selling point on this vise is the reversible jaws. These are easily big enough to use as a U-joint press and for holding extra large items. Plenty of room to put on soft jaws, very nice anvil with plenty of power. Nice action, even better after lubing the screw. I'd like to see a nice brass sleeve bushing on the screw end, but the machining is nice.
customer_reviews.author: GremlinMT

customer_reviews.title: Gave to my husband as a gift.
customer_reviews.text: He loves this vise. It is much heavier compared to the one he wanted. After researching I decided to get this from the warehouse and it was a great decision. He has a backhoe and needs something heavy duty at times and his older vise broke this summer. He has already used it to fix the tire chains for the backhoe and told me he was very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Marcieanne

customer_reviews.title: The Yost 855-D2 is one of the best vises out there
customer_reviews.text: The Yost 855-D2 is one of the best vises out there. I was a fabricator and machinist for 40 years, used a lot of vises, and this one is one of the best. The double lock downs, reversible jaws, and smooth operation of the main screw, make this one heck of a good buy. It's not a super heavy duty, but for a home shop or light fabrication work, it's more than adequate. And with the price, you cannot go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Vise
customer_reviews.text: The vise has heff into it, heavy. The price is reasonable. Another reason I purchased it, is the warranty it offer by manufacturer. It’s life time. What noticed, that I don’t like is the precision of some the parts. They are not equal, thin and fatter in for opposite part. But it looks very durable. I haven’t put it in it’s pace yet. I do recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: JJEE

customer_reviews.title: Decent value so far as new vises go.
customer_reviews.text: Yost eliminated the preload spring (which added resistance to the screw) some had complained about earlier. The casting appears to be good quality, and all the parts strength / size seem to be in proportion to one another. The pipe clamp jaws are attached via magnets, and don’t align very well at rest, but I suppose they will self-align when clamping a pipe, since they’re free to move about a little. I kind of wish they were bolted in place like the larger / stouter models.
customer_reviews.author: R. Helzer

customer_reviews.title: You can’t go wrong
customer_reviews.text: To put it simply, this is a BIG vise and worth the cost. When it arrived today and I saw it in the box, I thought I had messed up and should have bought the 6” model. Upon putting it on the bench (still pre-install), I know I made the right choice. It’s not made in the USA and that’s a negative but there’s nothing out there to compete with it. Compare the stats, Yost is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Rochester Nick

customer_reviews.title: Broken out of box, replacement okay
customer_reviews.text: Arrived broken, weak feet on the baseplate or bad casting. Will see if replacement is any better Update - the second one was fine. It's not super tight, and adjusting the base pivot is tricky, but it is heavily built and gets the job done. I'm happy. The pipe clamp under the jaws is sloppy, not tight. I took out the screws for the jaws to clean and anti seize them so they be able to come out if I want to swap it in the years to come
customer_reviews.author: Homertax

customer_reviews.title: I don't know why I waited to get this vise!
customer_reviews.text: Been waiting to purchase a vise and I just wanted to get a good one ,,. Hopefully it be the last one I buy... I really like the features and the clamping Force is great.. very solid unit.. well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Cheap cast metal base
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy, has a cheap cast metal base that will break like every other cheap vise you have owned. Mine arrived broken.
customer_reviews.author: vegassubscribe

customer_reviews.title: Beast
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for a few months now and enjoy it very much. One solid piece of metal with a comfortable handle. Unlocks and locks easily and rotates smoothly. Simply a solid professional tool.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sohm

customer_reviews.title: Great vise, very impressed.
customer_reviews.text: 1. I've been very impressed with this vise since 1st inspection, installation and usage. 2. There is very little movement in the dynamic jaw to the fixed jaw. 3. The vase base is beefy and the turn clamp plate underneath is a complete circle, I had another similar vice from another manufacturer and they had used a little piece of 1/4 by 1 inch flat stock that bent and broke quickly from use. 4. There is very little slop in the handle and there is no spring or pins on the shaft to take up the slack and cause a week point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the best vises I've ever used or owned and I'll had ...
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best vises I've ever used or owned and I'll had a few! The jaws open wider more than stated in the info and the mounting is very strong and stable, I don't know why you would consider taking the tension spring off the screw as it's much nicer to have the handle stay in whatever position you want it to and with out the spring it will always move to the vertical position.
customer_reviews.author: WaltSharpIdea

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: It's as good as my 70 year old Columbian maybe a little thinner casting. Very well made, and shipped flawlessly. Also have completely unboxed and tested. Castings look really well made so time will tell. Can't wait to put in use full time tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for most people that have use for this size vise.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for the Money Too New to see if it is durable.
customer_reviews.author: Lauro M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: After much research, I pulled the trigger on the 6.5 inch vise. Shipped fast and it has worked perfectly for about 3 months. I am a semi-pro mechanic and have beat the crap out of this vise and it has worked great. For the money I don't think you can go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Big W

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, stout, and extremely heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best vice money can buy. Very heavy duty. Once locked in position it doesn’t move no matter what. Not like other vices. This is a beast.
customer_reviews.author: mizer

customer_reviews.title: Good for heavy work
customer_reviews.text: Better than Wilton. Takes a beating in a heavy duty shop.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Thilges

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this vise. I can't think of any cons to discuss. I have read the reviews about breaking the cast iron parts under heavy load. I do woodworking with it mostly. I can't imagine the force that must have been applied to break one of these.
customer_reviews.author: BamaMania

customer_reviews.title: Thank you Yost for a great vise at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This vise is an incredible value for a hundred dollars delivered to your house. It is of ductile iron construction NOT cast iron, this is huge and if you don't know the difference it is worth your time to Google it. Thank you Yost for a great vise at a great price!!!
customer_reviews.author: Scott_S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent vice; the deal of the century
customer_reviews.text: Good design, well made, nicely finished and well packaged. I expect this vice to be around for the next 200 years. I'm going to make a set of aluminum soft jaws (3) first thing.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent P. Barkley

customer_reviews.title: Great American Made Steel Vise
customer_reviews.text: Try breaking this beast! The most versatile vise I've used and robust enough to absorb as much abuse you can throw at it. Way to Go Yost.
customer_reviews.author: vectorlogic

customer_reviews.title: great clamping
customer_reviews.text: machinist /welder for 40 years best vice ive ever used period.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: American made and made well!
customer_reviews.text: It’s not your harbor freight, only for the serious worker
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two vises in one.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for new shop. Great price and versatile being reversible. Greater quality than most vises out there in price range.
customer_reviews.author: Jas B

customer_reviews.title: Good looking vise
customer_reviews.text: Husband is thrilled with the quality, especially for the price. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: S. Vipperman

customer_reviews.title: great DEAL
customer_reviews.text: I put this vise in my garage and for the money you can't buy a better rugged vise anywhere. this vise is right up there with a 4 or5 hundred dollar vise I should buy as many as I can and resell them for 200.00 apiece and make a killing
customer_reviews.author: kevin lessard

customer_reviews.title: It is better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. It is better than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, needs to have a better install Kit!
customer_reviews.text: Which it came with the bolts to install it. The pattern on the paper they give doesn’t match up with the actual vise grip bolt holes, despite the paper patter unfolding extra largely look as if it was 1 to 1 scale size.
customer_reviews.author: thelma lynn Entwit

customer_reviews.title: Good fit and movement of its parts
customer_reviews.text: Well-built, good movement; the mounting holes needed a little drilling out to fit 3/4” lag bolts to mount on my wood bench top.
customer_reviews.author: michael rightmyer

customer_reviews.title: Great vice, very happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: Great vice, a lot bigger than I had pictured in my head. Very nice vice, very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kazmania

customer_reviews.title: Great vise!
customer_reviews.text: Like others, I had problems with the jaw insert screws but the people behind this vise really go the extra mile to resolve the problem. Once that was ironed out I was left with a really great vise. I would definitely buy this vise again.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: Great vice, and I've had a few
customer_reviews.text: Great vice, and I've had a few. You can't beat the price for a model like this one, at this level of quality.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Despres

customer_reviews.title: A well machined vise
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in excellent shape. Oiled the main screw as recommended by the manufacturer, and it works smoothly. The rotation is easy to permit and easy to secure in a fixed position. No rough edges noted.
customer_reviews.author: RJG Atlanta

customer_reviews.title: very well designed
customer_reviews.text: solid vise very well designed this is the vise to have
customer_reviews.author: donpepo

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for the workbench. Dimensions are perfect. Heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: troy burry

customer_reviews.title: Large strong and well built
customer_reviews.text: this vise is large and heavy duty. seems to be durable and strong. Exactly what I needed for my workbench.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney dog

customer_reviews.title: Nice Vise
customer_reviews.text: Greg Ames is any idiot. You can't beat this vise for they money! Great vise for 80$! Much larger than I expected. People will complain about how tight the handle is to turn. There is a strong spring on the adjustment screw that aids in reversing the jaws. It keeps the screw centered. You can remove it and position the snap ring in the other slot to aleviate this concern. It will be harder to line up when reversing the jaws but not to bad.
customer_reviews.author: Killa A-dogg

customer_reviews.title: Okey dokey, Smokey.
customer_reviews.text: Already seen a ton of usage. Very nice for the cost. Opens, closes, and spins great. I put some quality grease on it so it moves even better now. Only drawback for me was there's not much leeway to mount over the edge of my bench. But I'd buy another. Good luck finding anything made in the U.S. Even American flags at Walmart are Chinese. It says so in Spanish. Yikes.
customer_reviews.author: Nice442

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well built
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and well built. It can take a beating without beciming flimsy
customer_reviews.author: WALTER

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Durable and well made! I am pleased with this vise!
customer_reviews.author: Mat meek

customer_reviews.title: Nice, solid piece.
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid, well built vice. The swivel is a little hard to master. Not bad at all for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Randy King

customer_reviews.title: the screws on the plate by the handle is brittle like cheap metal but other than that the vice seems ...
customer_reviews.text: Feels solid, the screws on the plate by the handle is brittle like cheap metal but other than that the vice seems well made.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Yu

customer_reviews.title: nice to have good vice on my bench makes every ...
customer_reviews.text: Strong vice work very well, nice to have good vice on my bench makes every job easy. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: kevin engel

customer_reviews.title: China baby!
customer_reviews.text: The base broke on shipment, which explains alot from it lol.. im not expecting much from a china made vise, bad move yost..
customer_reviews.author: PawL

customer_reviews.title: Best vice ever
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy-duty versatile Vice. There's a lot more here than I thought there was. It locks in with double locks that have teeth on the bottom and it's real secure and steady and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Reese c Evans

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade for me.
customer_reviews.text: This vise is well built,has a few surface blimishs and it weighs what the web site has noted in the specs.The base lockdown is really well designed/with long handles.Machined surfaces are well finished.This vise is built to handle 137 Ft. Lbs of torque.
customer_reviews.author: Box maker.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: looks and works great. I use it extensivly and this vise can take a beating.
customer_reviews.author: Sofia

customer_reviews.title: I got this as a gift for my husband. ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my husband. He absolutely loves it. Also he couldn't believe what I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy D

customer_reviews.title: Good Product for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Larger than what I needed it for. Operates fine. For the dollars no issues. May not be heavy enough for industrial use but in a small auto shop, farm of operations of similar scale it would be a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: The Coach

product_meta.title: Yost Tools 865-D2 Industrial Grade 6.5" Reversible Vise
product_meta.description: Size:6.5"The Yost reversible Mechanics vises are designed for customer that demand the best quality products available. Built from heavy duty 65, 000 psi ductile iron, these vises are designed for more rugged applications than traditional cast iron vises. For over sized projects, the main bar of the vise can be removed and inserted in the reverse direction. This increases the jaw opening of the vise by an incredible 4 inches. Imported
feature_bullets: Heavy Duty 60, 000 PSI Ductile Iron Castings
Gear type locking system with double lock down bolts
Two Anvils: Lower: 3. 4" x 3. 6" Upper: 6. 5" x 2. 2"
